resources.string: We want to thank everyone who posted questions or advice on Piazza.\n We also want to thank Stack Overflow which helped us correct bugs, add in functionality and generally work out the kinks.

Creating a new game:
 Press New Game and provide the email of another user.
 If the user is available then you will both be provided the same board.
 Both of you play a full game of Boggle at your leisure.
 While you play you will be updated with the status of your opponent and you will be able to see their score as well as your own.

 Playing the game:
 Select letters by clicking on them.
 You can undo a selection by clicking on a previously selected letter (other than the letter you last selected).
 Submit a word by selecting the letter you last selected.

 Scoring:
 Words less than length 3 = 0 points
 Words of length 3-4 = 2 points
 Words greater than length 4 = length-2 points
This will overwrite your current game.

Persistent Boggle is a fast paced word finding puzzle. Starting with a 5x5 grid, the objective is to find more words of length 3 or more than your opponent.\n\n Created by Adam Gressen and Vaibhav Mahindroo.
Persistent Boggle is a a variation on the fast paced word finding puzzle game. Starting with a 5x5 grid, the objective is to find words of length 3 or more.

Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called ) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.
You must have a Google Account registered in order to play Persistent Boggle.
